poem:
The Broken System

In America, a land vast and free,  
lie the shadows of broken dreams,  
where wealth and health part ways,  
and every breath costs a fortune.  
Compassion, a whisper lost  
in corridors of power.  
Are lives measured in gold,  
or in the frail heartbeat  
of shared humanity?
